hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Squeeze Reversal in Low-Float Memecoins
hypothesis_content.statement: When low-float, high-attention memecoins (PEPE, DOGE, TRUMP) experience >15% price drop on below-average volume (< 30-day median) during NEUTRAL regimes, a sharp liquidity-driven rebound occurs within 24-36 hours as market makers refill order books.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volume sell-offs in attention-driven assets often represent weak hands exiting, not fundamental deterioration. Negative funding encourages shorts, creating squeeze potential. Market makers replenish liquidity after exaggerated moves, causing snapbacks.
entry_conditions: 24h volume < 30-day median volume for that asset
Entry on first 30-minute candle with volume spike > 2x previous candle
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If price continues declining >5% after volume spike entry, or fails to rebound >5% within 36 hours.
